a.title: SABIS International School Springfield Annual Report

h1.strong: Welcome to SABIS® International Charter School!

article.h1: Importance notice regarding COVID-19 and ongoing learning
article.h2: All of the latest updates can be found here.
article.p: April 2, 2020 message from our Interim School Director:

div.style: left: 0; width: 100%; height: 0; position: relative; padding-bottom: 75%;

iframe.style: border: 0; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; position: absolute;

article.p: SABIS® International Charter School (SICS) is a highly regarded institution that provides a high-quality education to a diverse population in the Springfield area. SICS strives to help all students to achieve their full potential, prepare them for success in college, equip them with the ability and desire for lifelong learning, and strengthen their civic, ethical, and moral values. The school maintains high standards of efficiency and accountability throughout its operation.

a.title: SABIS International School Springfield Annual Report

section.h4:
Seniors in the Spotlight
View All

br.span: Attending SABIS International Charter School gave Emily Morrow the foundation she needed to serve her country. “I had the opportunity to attend advanced level courses at SABIS, which prepared me to succeed at the U.S. Coast Guard Academy where they have a very rigorous curriculum,” says Emily. Equally important for her work in the Coast Guard, Emily says participating in the SABIS Student Life Organization prepared her to be a leader and gave her the skills to work with others as a team.

“SABIS made me the person I am today,” says Amari Q. Brown, a 2014 graduate of the SABIS International Charter School who is starting a promising job at Accenture in Charlotte, NC, as a management consultant analyst. Amari’s path to a promising career was paved by SABIS. When he was going into the 7th grade, his grandmother was looking around Springfield for the school that could offer him the best education in the city. She found SABIS. “When I entered the 7th grade at SABIS,

It is the season of “thanksgiving,” and Nabori Santiago has a lot to be thankful for, especially when it comes to the education he received at SABIS International Charter School of Springfield. “I wouldn’t be where I am today, and I definitely wouldn’t have had the confidence to get through the high stress college environment found at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology if it weren’t for SABIS,” says the aerospace engineering graduate. “Taking the

Andres Gomez is living his dream. It’s a dream he was prepared to pursue through the education he received while attending SABIS International Charter School of Springfield. “There was a challenging culture created at SABIS that encouraged you to continue to grow and move forward in life,” says Andres. “In other schools I attended, I knew there were some classes I could breeze by, but that was never the case at SABIS. There was always an opportunity to challenge yourself and

Xiomara Alban of Springfield has accomplished great things since graduating from SABIS International Charter School and earning her college degree at the University of New Hampshire Durham in 2010. “I was very active as a student leader at college after learning how to lead while at SABIS. At UNH, I founded the first multicultural and only sorority on campus,” she says proudly, noting her parents emigrated to the U.S. from Ecuador. Today Xiomara is Associate Director of Admissions at Elms

Stephanie Morin wants to dedicate her life to changing the world. Currently a doctoral student at UMass Amherst studying molecular and cellular biology, Stephanie’s path in life was set in motion while attending the SABIS International Charter School in Springfield. It was Stephanie’s mom – looking for a better opportunity for her daughter – who signed her up to attend SABIS. “In hindsight, I’m happy she did. I was one of those smart kids who stuck out. At SABIS I

Trevon Jones graduated in May 2018 from Bentley University with a major in finance, and he is determined to use the opportunities he has had in life to help others. A major factor enabling many of the opportunities he has had so far is the SABIS International Charter School. “Going to SABIS stimulated my intellectual curiosity,” says Trevon. Truth be told, initially he didn’t want to attend SABIS. “My mom wanted the best possible education for me, but I was more concerned about

When SABIS International Charter School opened in Springfield in 1995, Brittany Archey was there. Her mom wanted a better education for her, one where she could grow and have consistency and not have to move around from elementary to middle to high school. “[SABIS] has a very rigorous curriculum…it allowed you to learn a lot,” Brittany says. As an example of the rigorous program, I took two math classes in college and both were below the level I had at SABIS.” Brittany credits

div.p: SABIS® is a global education network that has an active presence in 20 countries on five continents.
SAGA is the alumni association serving thousands of SABIS® alumni around the world.
The SABIS® Careers website features job openings from across the global SABIS® Network.

div.h5:
School Closure
SABIS International Charter School Closed

div.p: Governor Baker ordered all Massachusetts schools to remain closed through the end of the 2019-20 school year. We will provide additional information as it becomes available.

For further information please contact us on:
sics.sabis.net
